actions.committee: House Committee on Energy and Commerce
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Energy and Commerce
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Environment and Hazardous Materials.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Environment and Hazardous Materials

official_title: To require the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency to prescribe a rule that prohibits the importation for disposal of polychlorinated biphenyls at concentrations of 50 parts per million or greater.

summary.text: Amends the Toxic Substances Control Act to require the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency to promulgate rules to prohibit the importation for disposal of polychlorinated biphenyls (PCBs), or PCB items, at concentrations of 50 parts per million or greater. Permits exemptions from this prohibition for specific transboundary shipments into the United States for disposal of such materials.

titles.title: To require the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency to prescribe a rule that prohibits the importation for disposal of polychlorinated biphenyls at concentrations of 50 parts per million or greater.
